Facts and Events

Name Anna Rice Gender Female Birth[1] Dedham, Norfolk, Massachusetts, United States Marriage Based on birth of eldest known child

to Nathaniel Tolman Marriage Needham, Norfolk, Massachusetts, United Statesto Nathaniel Ayers Death[2][3] Needham, Norfolk, Massachusetts, United States

References

↑ Dedham (Massachusetts). Town Clerk; Julius Herbert Tuttle; Benjamin Fisher; and Don Gleason Hill. The early records of the town of Dedham, Massachusetts. (Dedham, Massachusetts: Dedham Transcript Press, 1886-1936)

Vol. 1, p. 26.

Anna, the daughter of John & Elizebeth Rice, was born Desember 27, 1694.

↑ Massachusetts State Society, Daughter of the American Revolution. Vital Records of Needham, Massachusetts: Births to 1845, Marriages to 1850, Deaths to 1850. (manuscript, 1959)

p. 126.

Ayres

Anne wife of Nathaniel, [died] July 20, 1740.

↑ Massachusetts. Probate Court (Suffolk County). Probate records, 1636-1899. (Salt Lake City, Utah: Genealogical Society of Utah, 1969-1971)

Case 7569.

18 Mar 1740[/41]: Bond of Nathanael Tolman Husbandman of Needham as administrator of his Mother Anna Ares Deced late Wife of Nath'l Ares of Needham Husbandman. Letters granted Vol. 35, p. 300.

Vol. 35, p. 328: 14 Apr 1741: Inventory of Anne Ares Deced Late Wife of Nath'l Ares of Needham: £500, by Robert Cook, James Kingsbery, Josiah Newell. All real estate.

Vol. 36, p. 291-292 21 Jan 1741[/42] Real estate not Capable of being divided among all her Children. 7 Jan 1742[/43]: Judge's decree settling it on Nathaniel Tolman Eldest Son he paying brothers and sisters Ebenezer Tolman, Thomas Tolman, John Ares, Aaron Ares, Jemima Tolman & Mary Tolman. Vol. 21, p. 346 7 Jan 1742[/43]: Bond of Nathaniel Tolman Husbandman of Needham to pay his brothers & sisters.

[23 Oct 1750: Nathanael Tolman of Needham cited to appear to show cause why brother Thomas Tolman not paid his share of estate of your Mother Anna Ares. 26 Oct 1750: Thomas Tolman constitutes Nath'l Ames of Dedham his attorney to hear Answer of Nathaniel Tolman. Nothing further listed.]
